pr_title: Implemented perf module utilizing jmeter to run multi thread GRPC load test

timeline.message:
Implemented perf module utilizing jmeter to run multi thread load tests against grpc for historic and incoming messages

Signed-off-by: Nana-EC <56320167+Nana-EC@users.noreply.github.com>

Pull in data generator updates from master

Signed-off-by: Nana-EC <56320167+Nana-EC@users.noreply.github.com>

Add default test include to run base test only

Signed-off-by: Nana-EC <56320167+Nana-EC@users.noreply.github.com>

Moved db connection props to test plan jmx. Also updated success criteria for clients

Signed-off-by: Nana-EC <56320167+Nana-EC@users.noreply.github.com>

Merge branch 'master' into grpcperfpilot

Signed-off-by: Nana-EC <56320167+Nana-EC@users.noreply.github.com>

timeline.author: steven-sheehy

timeline.bodyText: tpcnm? Please spell out variables. instantref should just be instant or something descriptive like startTime.
timeline.author: steven-sheehy
steven-sheehy

timeline.bodyText: Spell out variables. Use this.threadNum = threadNum; for assignments
timeline.author: steven-sheehy

timeline.bodyText: What's THRD? Thread name/num should already be printed by log4j2.
timeline.author: steven-sheehy

replies.bodyText:
Just a shorted version of "Thread". jMeter has it's own logic to create logs, the Log4j2 pattern isn't honoured. You have to programmatically get the thread name if you want it.
This helps differentiate the log details amongst thread in the test results .log file.
replies.author: Nana-EC

timeline.bodyText: Push if statement into ConnectionHandler. Then this method can be deleted and logic is encapsulated.
timeline.author: steven-sheehy

timeline.bodyText: Is it not possible to use domain and repositories here because of JMeter?
timeline.author: steven-sheehy

replies.bodyText: Yes, per my understanding that's correct. The Jmeter application is essentially running the entire flow. Everything else serves as dependencies for mostly class information. Spring features don't seem to work.
replies.author: Nana-EC

timeline.message:
Updated generator to emit topic messages on create and update. Also updated jmeter TopicMessageGenerator emission logic
